text: human hands are a miracle of evolution
but how did we get them the answer has
eluded scientists for years now recent
research suggests that leading theories
were wrong
for years experts suspected that human
hands either evolve from a fish's
pectoral fin or were a novel
evolutionary trait with no predecessors
but a new genetic study shows that our
hands likely come from fin rays Neil
Shubin of the University of Chicago says
that was shocking it ran counter to
everything we thought fin rays may look
similar to fingers but they're made of a
different bone type if they don't grow
like fingers which is why researchers
ignore them for years but then
scientists started manipulating genes
and mice and zebrafish and it turns out
there are two genes and mice and fish
that generate legs and fins deleting
these genes leave Stubbs on mice but it
also stunts fin rate growth and
zebrafish this similar result is an
unusual link between two very different
species and suggests that human hands
weren't some random mutation rather
they're living proof of our ancient
watery past according to Neil Shubin it
shows us how bodies are built and how we
evolved
